website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay up for this option, but this premium backpacking stove is lightweight, easy to use, and heats water fast.
pros: Has a small footprint when folded
just screw onto a portable propane canister
Up to 2 hours burn time on a canister
Burner arms are serrated to better hold pots
2.5 minutes to boil one liter of water
cons: Match ignition can be difficult in bad weather
Some note problems with the valve falling off after a few months of use

customer_reviews.title: Like all camping
customer_reviews.text: My wife finally broke down and decided that we have to have coffee in the morning when we're camping even though neither one of us wants to build a fire. Like all camping, it's just a more pleasant version of being in the Army and I already had a solution. My buddy had one of these when we were stuck out in the box at NTC for a month getting sand blasted, trading hot coffee for cigarettes and candy. Light weight, fast heat.
customer_reviews.author: DEREK K MC ROBERTS

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Going back to the original PocketRocket which has never failed me. Used the new PocketRocket 2 on a 100 mile trip in Washington and due to a little moisture it got completely corroded and is now broken, and one leg won't even fold. I am not sure exactly what caused this, possibly the material the center part is made of, but is problem the original PocketRocket doesn't have which I have used for almost 10 years. This is a terrible product, I would not recommend to anyone. MSR really let me down on this one!! :(
customer_reviews.author: Uriah G.

customer_reviews.title: Nice lighter weight sub for my old Jetboil
customer_reviews.text: Nice lighter weight sub for my old Jetboil. Not as good in the wind, but there is usually a sheltered area to use the Rocket. Really nice piece of kit for ultralight backpacking and hunting. Can be used as a decent fire starter as well! Keep in mind that the Rocket doesn't have a built-in igniter, so you'll have to bring a lighter, matches, flint and steel, or the MSR pen igniter.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Good sweetspot beween price, weight, durability
customer_reviews.text: There's a lot of cheaper backpacking stoves on the market. There's some that are lighter. There's some that are more durable. But the MSR PocketRocket is a great sweet-spot between price, durability, and weight, and I've owned or given several as gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Reiss-Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking stove
customer_reviews.text: So after using the $10 stove for a few years, I decided to upgrade. The stove folds up great and comes with a small case. I used it on a very windy weekend and had no problem boiling water very quickly. It’s faster than the $10 Stove i have been using (which I like that stove too). I’m happy I bought this stove!
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.Top Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Lacking
customer_reviews.text: After using a similar cheap $10 stove for the past I decided to get this. I didn’t realize there is no ignition... like seriously?? My $10 stove had one so maybe I can retrofit it onto this one. It’s way overpriced for what it is. In my opinion get a cheap $10 stove with an ignition on it. They are the same exact thing!
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Blades

customer_reviews.title: Very good little stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for backpacking, but this winter I have actually wound up using it on the back deck during power outages to make myself a nice warm cup of coffee or warm up some soup. The canisters are recyclable locally if you get the tool to puncture the canister with to show it is empty. I am delighted with how well this little stove works. It also folds up nicely and takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Thornton-Wiatt

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stove. The name isn't a joke
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stove. The name isn't a joke, full blast looks and sounds like an upside-down rocket ship. I would imagine if you weren't careful you may have an issue with cheap aluminum cookware, it's just so hot. And you arent going to be able to put a 10 inch skillet on it very comfortably. But if you came for a big, cold stove you are on the totally wrong page
customer_reviews.author: Bushcraft710

customer_reviews.title: Spews fuel on my hand every time I install on a fuel can.
customer_reviews.text: There are tons of reviews and videos for this stove so I won't bother bragging on it. What I will say is there is a significant fuel leakage each time I thread this stove onto a tank. Scared me the first time and the fuel was super cold on my hand. The subsequent other times I have threaded it down as fast as I can and still had fuel escape onto my hands every single time no matter what brand of fuel can I'm using.
customer_reviews.author: 2Manyhobbies

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: I own two other MSR stoves of which I have used throughout the past 26 years and have been very happy with so I figured when I was going ultra light on a spring bear hunt this season I would pick up this tiny little stove purely based on the MSR name and brand of products. ABSOLUTELY NO DISAPPOINTMENT AT ALL. The reviews are all true. Boils two(2) cups of water in 2 min., packs super small, ultralight and so easy to use a toddler could figure it out. BUY IT if you're in the market for an ultralight, compact isobutane stove for under 8000ft. backpacking or outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: NTODWILD

customer_reviews.title: Flame spreader head diameter too small.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the excellent control at the low end of the gas valve, but found the flame spreader head to be too small. It's easy to burn food to the bottom center of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Zato Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Good Stove
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fine stove but the storage box it comes with doesn’t fit the stove. No matter how you bend the little arms around. The box doesn’t fit the stove. I will have to find a Tupperware or something else to fit it. Sort of a fail on their design team. It’s not in the storage box when shipped it’s anchored in a good box but it’s not in the storage container. They couldn’t get it to fit at the factory either. Update: I figured out how to fold it correctly and utilize my storage box.
customer_reviews.author: CowgirlMom

customer_reviews.title: High quality, lightweight, compact, easy to use and stow away. and yet affordable
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the few exceptions to the rule: Cheap, durable, Light. you can only choose 2. In addition to this its easy to use and stow away. I would not consider buying anything else than this. easy to boil water and even cook food. The fuel can will take up the majority of the space. Its too bad you cant buy those online without paying those pesky hazmat fees. however you can get them at most local stores for about 5$ Really great stove i couldnt be happier. I love all my MSR products.
customer_reviews.author: Craig m.

customer_reviews.title: Uber light yet feels solid
customer_reviews.text: Wow. It’s so light yet feels so solid compared to my super cheap stove. In 34 degree temps boiled 16 oz of water in just over 2.5 minutes. Very happy. Yes it sounds like a rocket but is now my go to stove for all my adventures simply due to construction and performance. Very very happy
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Whoooo hoooo!
customer_reviews.text: You could charr a steak in a 20lb cast iron pan in the middle of a tornado with this thing. It's actually shocking how good this stove is. Somebody definitely put a lot of thought into the design and use of this product. There is a hairpin fuel adjustment allows you to control your heat source with methodic precision. This is not a cheap stove compare that to some of the others, but you do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Neuser

customer_reviews.title: PocketRocket is awesome
customer_reviews.text: PocketRocket is amazing. Always have been. Keep it up. I thru hiked the Appalachian Trail, the Pacific Crest Trail, and the Continental Divide Trail with these guys. I went though a few of them due to the nature of thru-hiking. This new one is a little different than the ones I'm used to. It folds down nicely. Seems a bit less durable than the original ones though. If you're debating which canister stove to get - you've found your baby.
customer_reviews.author: NETTI

customer_reviews.title: Cooks super fast
customer_reviews.text: This boils water incredibly fast, I never knew water could be boiled on a stove this quickly, it takes less than 5 minutes to do a liter. I've always used some crappy coleman stove thinking it didn't matter and made no difference, but wow this is really fast and I'm pretty sure I am using less fuel too. I highly recommend this for camping, I brought it backpacking and its completely changed how I do lunch, now I don't mind stopping and cooking lunch because it is so quick.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Smith

customer_reviews.title: Instead of fast food and the money spent on it, why not prepare your own and cook what you love!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's portable and light and works like a charm. Comes with the storage box that fits in your pocket/purse and within the box, there's enough space to fit a mini lighter. Cooking with this stove is great but on windy days, gets a little difficult. The knob to adjust the heat is exceptional, the heat does't dissipate towards it so no worries about being burn. The three leg stand keep pots and some can goods balanced well but as mention before, a gust of wind can ruined your meal. Great product by MSR.
customer_reviews.author: Bruised Li

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Easy to understand, plenty of flame control and still light weight and compact.
customer_reviews.author: M.L.K

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and effecient
customer_reviews.text: The downside is the metal waste from the little cans and the carrying case. I tried to add up the numbers, and it looks like I get about twice as much metal waste per liter of water boiled with this stove over my traditional white gas stove. But aside from those two things, everything else is an upside to this stove. The little plastic carrying case is just useless. It holds the stove, and an MSR piezo lighter, but it won't stay closed, which makes it useless.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Colburn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Feels a bit delicate. But I just keep it in the case whenever I’m not using it. Got it last Thanksgiving and have used it 3-4 times. So far so good. It is louder than I thought so there’s no problem of knowing when it’s on/off and easily lights with a match.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great but needs a piezo lighter
customer_reviews.text: PROS 1). MSR quality 2). Compact 3). Dependable CONS: 1). No piezo lighter and most other stoves now have them 2). Terrific but have had much cheaper knockoffs (with piezo lighters) perform just as well. Not sure if I’m paying for the name brand
customer_reviews.author: Paul Leach

customer_reviews.title: Great when you don't have much room for stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take with me on motorcycle trips. I use it to heat water for my dehydrated meals when I'm camping. It is small, really small. I keep it in my cup that I used to boil water. If you need a lightweight and small stove this is the one for you. I have never gone wrong with MSR gear.
customer_reviews.author: Kris B.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and simple cooking
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times now and it has worked great. The size and weight are a big improvement over my previous stove and ease of use is perfect for backpacking meals. Most of my backpacking meals consist of bringing the contents to a boil and turning off the stove. I plan on using it for a 5 day backpacking trip in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: B Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: Do not hesitate, this stove is great. I bought this because the cheaper BRS stove does not hold a steady flame unless you have it wide open, at least that's my experience. This stove lets you control the heat to exactly what you desire so it is possible to do more than just boil water. My only complaint is that it is quite a bit heavier than the BRS.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, collapsible and light.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite backpacking gadget I own. Its so tiny and easy to pack. Fits with the tank perfectly in my single serving pot. I love that its collapsible. I wish though that it fit a regular tank. The little ones are harder to find.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good... Except
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this to replace my cheap stove. I got it just in time for my camping trip. I opened the package to test it before going to the field and found that one of the pot holder support arms was loose when moved into position for use while the other two were locked into place. I attempted to tighten the arm but it didn't really help. Sadly, I don't have time to return it before my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Roger A Park

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Idea, folds crazy small, super powerful, and the legs don’t lock open. When you stir yourself pot of whatever, it Will fall, the legs just bend right over. Awful design!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ash N.

customer_reviews.title: This works very well
customer_reviews.text: My husband demonstrated this for me. He hooked it up to the little fuel tank and lit it. (The fuel doesn’t come with it - they are sold on Amazon at Walmart and Academy) It is a great little camping stove. It could be helpful during a winter power outage for boiling water. It is very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: L  Willis

customer_reviews.title: Pocket rocket!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pocket rocket is right...this thing throws out some heat and boils water for freeze dried food in no time. Tiny, compact, and folds up small enough so it can fit inside my Coleman cut (also sold on amazon) that i make my food in.
customer_reviews.author: kyle f.

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing constantly and have owned several. Handy and compact for any camper, backpacker, bicyclist, or traveler. It gets the job done. I prefer it paired with the 16 oz primus fuel as it lasts the longest and makes resupply planning easier.
customer_reviews.author: kiltabilly

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight. Great for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a cooking stove that would work well for all my backpacking needs. I do a lot of camping/backpacking, and this little item was perfect for what I needed it for. Read a lot of reviews, and viewed many products, and this one Im happy to say exceeded my expectations. Was extremely easy to use, and I like the little case it fits into. Fits into my cookware set perfectly for easier storage into backpack. Recommend getting if in the market for a quality cooking stove
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas R Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great compact stove
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for a while now. Still holding up well. Have a little bit of rust forming from storing for months in high humidity, but was able to wipe off pretty easy with CLP. Best small stove I've used. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: The MSR Pocketrocket 2 is ultralight weight and compact. Worked great to quickly boil water and cook on a recent backpacking trip. Was not able to find MSR fuel locally, so used it with a jet boil fuel can that worked great (I loved the irony... especially since I looked at the jet boil unit). Would definitely recommend it for backpacking or camping.
customer_reviews.author: MOD96

customer_reviews.title: PR2 definitely improved
customer_reviews.text: Nicely improved upon mini stove. The pot supports now rotate downward, and fold under the burner. This whole thing folded up, fits in the palm of my hand. Also puts out a screaming 8500 BTU's
customer_reviews.author: blackhorseveteran

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ultralight backpacking stove
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little stove, have cooked several meals between 5000' to 8000' and haven't had any issues. Seems to be efficient burns very nicely! Folds up very small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Akashla74

customer_reviews.title: Why hesitate?  But it.  You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stove for my adventures. Backpacking, kayak camping, hiking etc. Lightweight. Easy to use. Simple design. Also works great during power outages.
customer_reviews.author: Walter O.

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, durable and adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade from the pocket rocket! This packs down ridiculously small, it’s amazing! It’s nice being able to adjust the width of the feet for different sizes of cookware too. Very durable and works great even after about 75-100 uses! It’ll last for a long time!!
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only a few words to say. If your a backpacker highly consider getting this stove. This is the best stove I’ve ever used. Super reliable. Excellence at its best!
customer_reviews.author: ahiker4u

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Took this up to 11,000 feet and camped in rock and snow. It did just fine. I made a wind block with some rocks and that helped. Light is the key.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal R

customer_reviews.title: No surprises.  Seems well made.
customer_reviews.text: I have been burned (no pun intended) so many times on this site that I am delighted when I get something that is well made and works as advertised. This little stove seems very nice so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Search is over for the best
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping or anywhere you need a quick stove. Really compact and powerful. Simply the best. I've used two other brands and returned them after using this pocket rocket. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: The guy from that thing

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and I love how light weight it is.
customer_reviews.author: J W.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and fast. Just right for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: It works like a charm! Boils my water rapidly and folds up nicely for backpacking. I have no downsides to this camp stove.
customer_reviews.author: Emilie Rabbitt

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight. Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this great little cookstove so far. Lightweight, extremely easy to use. Heated snow to boil in about 6 minutes. Performs well in cold and in wind (unlike many other versions that look similar and cost a few dollars less).
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact little unit.
customer_reviews.text: Nice stove! Very compact. Well built and sturdy. I used it on a summer backpacking trip in Oregon recently and it performed as advertised. The included small hard plastic case had just enough room to also hold a MSR piezo igniter. Great for my ultra light trips.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable I used this stove while on a backpacking trip in the north cascades National forest and it worked perfectly and the flame never went out from the wind and it boiled water very fast. I think it’s work the money because it’s reliable. Thanks MSR 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Cole’s outdoor vids

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my backpacking kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! MSR Quality and easy to use! Works really well! Used it on JMT a few months ago! Can’t wait to use it again
customer_reviews.author: GS_adventure_Guy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT camp stove!
customer_reviews.text: This stove is a perfect backup to the original Pocket Rocket. Still waiting for the original to give out, after several years of rough use.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck H.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Loud
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is loud. Knocked a star off for that. I've used it for 1 camping trip so far: 3 days and 2 nights. It boiled the water very quickly. My original pocket rocket still works after 10+ years of moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Meier

customer_reviews.title: the best all around stove I've ever used and I use it daily
customer_reviews.text: what can I say? It's a classic and my 3rd identical purchase over a 10+ year stint of nearly daily usage. Hands down the one stove I'd buy if I could only have one. Portability, durability (great carry case included) y. Only the best. If you intend to use it often, buy an adapter to use 1lb green propane tanks. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: paolo Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design and construction. I can tell this will hold up for a very long time. Operation can become a little tricky after cooking for an extended period of time as the shut off valve is very close to the metal arms. Hot metal met finger a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thedford

customer_reviews.title: Now I know why it’s called rocket
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It heats quickly. The heat dispersal is superior to cheap knock offs. There is real design that goes into the workings of this stove. I love the compact and there for portability if it. I would recomend to anybody looking for a small backpacking stove.
customer_reviews.author: Dinguskon

customer_reviews.title: Great Stove
customer_reviews.text: High quality backpack stove. Folds down into a very compact size. Carry container is sturdy. No pizo lighter, so you will need a lighter, but not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Quality unsurpassed
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is quite a bit more expensive than its cheap counterparts. The significant difference is that the components are far superior to the counterfeits. Don't waste your money buying the fuel on Amazon at $30 for a canister as opposed to $5 at your local sporting goods store.
customer_reviews.author: ReyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stove for Alaskan backpacking adventures!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this stove a handful of times while backpacking out in the mountains. It works wonderfully! Boils water quick and packs down small. Couldn't ask for a better stove!
customer_reviews.author: mucleo sartor

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight and ultra easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use and compact and lightweight! Wide enough for just about any camp cookware you have
customer_reviews.author: John Webster

customer_reviews.title: Great stove - if you are on the edge, buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic stove - easy to use, and a reliable cut off valve (no leaks). Produces a good flame and is very study for camping or day hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Navy

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight and a lot of flexibility
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons I bought the pocket rocket is I do a lot of fishing on my through hikes, I wanted a light weight stove with a lot of flexibility. This stove does an awesome job boiling water and frying fish on a pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Brought this little thing on a road trip from MN to WA to hike the Wonderland Trail - worked perfectly at every elevation! Tiny and compact. Fit inside my MSR pot with the fuel. Would definitely recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ansmn

customer_reviews.title: Great backpacking stove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stove for backpacking as it does more than just boil water due to the adjustable power levels. Love the size as it fits nicely inside my GSR cook set.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and effective with a lot of power!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to start and use. I was worried that my tall pot wouldn't balance well but it has done just fine. It’s tiny and works better than I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: missdulcemia

customer_reviews.title: A compact, solid, user-friendly stove...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to use, extremely efficient. An all-around solid performer. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: wheelgunner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for and this is a great little stove. Intense, powerful heat production.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Brenner

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and functional
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove. Works like a charm and it is S-M-A-L-L!
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Chernikov

customer_reviews.title: Great burner, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Liked everything, but it does need a hard carrying case like the PR2.
customer_reviews.author: Jackofalltrades

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Rocket Version 2 Is Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. The original Pocket Rocket was great, but the improvements made to this make it even better. I feel I have more control over the flame with version 2. Make sure you get the stabilizer legs as that makes it nice when on uneven ground.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Henry

customer_reviews.title: Arm broken after just few uses
customer_reviews.text: We used pocketrocket just few times and one of the arms melted at base and now it’s not even so you can’t put anything on it. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great stove and is always at the top of best-of ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually received this late from Amazon, but it's MSR and we had an extra pocketrocket to use for our trip so I'm giving this thing 5 stars anyways. Great stove and is always at the top of best-of lists if you Google around. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Nice camp stove.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and light weight. Perfect for backpacking and can be stored in cooking gear. I have not used it in high wind conditions but I feel the flame would not go out.
customer_reviews.author: ALMBeau

customer_reviews.title: Epic
customer_reviews.text: So small, so good. Still brings a smile to my face popping it out of its little container. Burns nice and low, but also like a jet engine when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Ksears

customer_reviews.title: Takes up virtually no space and works very well. ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes up virtually no space and works very well. It holds a heavy pan surprisingly well and cools quickly. My sister has a large single burner stove top and they were using this instead of their own due to the power and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, I admit I even prefer it to my MSR liquid stove.
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent product, I always swore liquid fuel stoves were the way forward... but on shorter trips I'm glad i bought this. A lot less messing around. I can nest it in my pot with canister saves tons of space.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Strong flame ultra compact
customer_reviews.text: Its a pocket rocket. Its reliable, has a strong flame, and can be packed away to almost nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove, it has a reputation for being a quality, reliable ultralight piece of equipment. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Matt Mead

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to light
customer_reviews.text: Used stove for a back counry fishing trip in the Uinta mountains. Great product, easy to light, takes up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: Darren T.

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Must have for multi day hikes. Boiled water very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Larrabee

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. I had issue with another brand with changing flame heights but this was very steady.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Carilli

customer_reviews.title: Best backpacking stove ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best backing stove ever! Untra light and boils water super fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen B

customer_reviews.title: THIS BURNER KICKS ASS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: One liter of water...boiling in 2 minutes....in the wind and rain of Turquoise Lake. Extremely impressive little gadget. For car camping I may get a Coleman portable but this bad boy would be all one needs in the back country. One piece of advice is to just go to REI to get fuel. Only $5 for an 8 ounce can.
customer_reviews.author: DarkVanilla

customer_reviews.title: So light and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Went camping and it was so easy to use and so light and small. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Hot & Fast but check your cup size
customer_reviews.text: Great little stove for hiking/camping. Not ideal if you use a smaller cook cup (450-550) as it doesn't stay on easily.
customer_reviews.author: Brandylyn

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to make water hot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in the woods numerous times with the MSR fuel canister. I am very happy with this item. It works every time and easy. I used it in January in Northern New York when it was below 0.0, and it worked just fine. Never an issue. I just used this item in the summer, and am happy that I have it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Small and light
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small, light stove. So far I have only used it for a quick overnight backpacking trip. It worked perfectly for my purpose. Since it is so small, it might not be ideal for all situations.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Improper item
customer_reviews.text: It was not accordingly by the description and the material was made of so cheap metal.Get break after burning for two times.So useless and ateast should not show the beautenw in the video.Lot of people get confusion that it comes with the beautnene tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaks whatsoever
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fantastic. I got a cheapo version for like 10 dollars a few years back and it would leak gas while screwing on and off the canister. VERY DANGEROUS. This one doesnt do that at all.... so far. Ive gone through just one small canister. But I highly recommend. Well made product and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: however I had to bend 2 of the burner arms pretty aggressively to keep my pot from being unlevel
customer_reviews.text: Works well, however I had to bend 2 of the burner arms pretty aggressively to keep my pot from being unlevel. Burns very efficiently and super small.
customer_reviews.author: josh s

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight Stove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping. Super light and effective. Cools down extremely quickly too and packs away nicely in the included box.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Little Rocket
customer_reviews.text: Throws off a flame as big and loud as an F-16. Boils water WAY faster than expected yet fits entirely in the palm of my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Clark

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding stove!
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight and reliable. Takes up almost no space in my pack. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. We now make meals while long day hiking when we never did before. Like how it folds up into small container when backpacking. Simple to use
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Do it!
customer_reviews.text: Must have for camping we used all the time. Because of the size, weight and convenience it’s a no brainer to add to your outdoor experience. The product speaks for itself.
customer_reviews.author: courtney dion

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we needed for son's Boy Scout camping trips. Although it can be a little difficult to fold the legs, It is very light and compact.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly T.

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and durable
customer_reviews.text: I've used my dad's like this for years and finally bought my own. Boils water fast enough and can fit right inside my mug so it takes up no room.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor K

customer_reviews.title: This one’s even better!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought the pocket rocket could be improved upon. I was mistaken. This one’s even better!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gift so I am not sure what it is or what it does. Hoping he likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Problem with valve total disfunction.
customer_reviews.text: delivered May 11 died on me (problem with valve) July 1
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Mudge

customer_reviews.title: Compact and big on variety
customer_reviews.text: Small , Light weight , easy to pack and really puts out a lot of heat but can simmer with the best.
customer_reviews.author: Oldsparkey

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: This is far and away more reliable than the other small backpacking stoves I've used. I wish I had bought it in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MSR’ is a good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s the first one I’ve ever had. And I’m useing a ton I have no complaints. MSR’ is a good product
customer_reviews.author: Eli Price

product_meta.title: MSR PocketRocket Ultralight Backpacking, Camping, and Travel Stove
product_meta.description: The MSR PocketRocket Ultralight and Compact Backpacking, Camping, and Travel Stove is the ideal solution for minimalist and fast-and-light adventures, hiking, trekking, and global travel. The trusted choice of alpinists and campers, for its durability and reliability, it’s easy to setup and operate—no priming, preheating, pumping, or pressurizing is required—and boils one liter of water in just 3.5 minutes. Simmer or boil, and adjust the flame anywhere in between for temperature-controlled gourmet cooking in the outdoors. Collapsible serrated pot-supports offer grip and stability, and can accommodate a wide range of pot sizes and styles for all types of meal prep. Fueled by high-performance isobutane-propane canister fuel (not included), it’s a good choice for global travel, as self-sealing threaded canister fuel is available in most countries worldwide. Available in 2 styles: The PR 2: Ultra Compact stove weighs 2.6 ounces (4.2 ounces in its included hard case), measures 4.8x4.8x3.6 inches when open, and packs down to 2x2x3 inches; the PR Deluxe : With Piezo Igniter weighs 2.9 ounces (3.4 ounces in the included stuff sack) and measures 1.5x2.2x3.3 inches when open. Manufacturer’s 3-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Ultralight (2.6 oz) and compact (2x2x3 in) folding canister stove for minimalist adventures, backpacking, hiking, trekking, camping, and global travel
Boils one liter of water in just 3.5 minutes and flame easily adjusts from a simmer to a rolling boil for gourmet cooking in the outdoors
Fueled by high-performance isobutane-propane fuel canister (not included); self-sealing threaded canister fuel is available in most countries
Easy to setup and operate—no priming, preheating, or pressurizing is required; serrated pot-supports accommodate a wide range of pot sizes and styles
Lightweight protective case included; stove weighs 2.6 oz (4.2 oz with case), measures 4.8x4.8x3.6 inches open, collapses to 2x2x3 inches
